### Exercise, Gender barchart
+ Draw a bar chart showing the number of people in each gender (use the Sex variable).

### Exercise, Gender barchart, Python (1/2)
+ Python code
```{}
ch = alt.Chart(df).mark_bar().encode(
    x='sex',
    y='count()'
)
```

### Exercise, Gender barchart, Python (2/2)

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import altair as alt
df = pd.read_csv("../data/titanic3.csv")
ch = alt.Chart(df).mark_bar().encode(
    x='sex',
    y='count()'
)
ch.save("../images/python-gender-barchart.html")
```

![](../images/gender-barchart.png)

### Exercise, Gender barchart, R (1/2)
+ R code

```{}
ggplot(titanic, aes(sex)) +
  geom_bar()
```

### Exercise, Gender barchart, R (2/2)

```{r r-gender-barchart}
fn <- initiate_image()
ggplot(titanic, aes(sex)) +
  geom_bar()
finalize_image()
```
